inn1.comm: full on the stumps, clipped away through square leg, well timed and a long chase for Moeen from long leg, a slide keeps them to three
length ball just outside off firmly blocked to cover

similar delivery, leaves Perera a little and he edges to second slip! Simple catch from Jordan and an early strike for England. Perera feeling for the ball slightly that's angled across him, no real foot movement and it was a thick outside edge and an easy chance for Jordan
length just outside off, carefully defended into the covers
playing late, gets an inside edge that almost threatens to rebound back onto the stumps but was wide
slightly straighter and knocked up the wicket
back of a length and pulled through square leg, great timing, took that off the front foot, Ponting-esque
similar delivery but Dilshan late on this and gets hit on the body
fuller at the stumps, clipped only to square leg
just outside off, driven up to mid-off
good length on off stump, blocked up the wicket
touch shorter, Dilshan stays leg side of it and angles out into the covers
full length at the stumps, dropped in front of midwicket where Bopara dives and saves but still can't prevent a sharp single
length at the off stump, driven off a thick inside edge to square leg
driven again, this bounces over Finn but not past mid-off
wider line and thrashed through the covers, chance to free the arms and Dilshan timed it well and got it in the gap
excellent comeback, drops the length a little, tightens the line, it nibbles a wee bit and Dilshan was beaten trying to defend
fuller and straighter, knocked to midwicket
A little straight and tickled down to long leg
too wide and cut for four, any width to Dilly and it goes
short of a length, wheeled down to long leg
length ball just outside off, punched off the back foot to cover
tighter line, angled out to backward point
straighter line again, clipped wide of square leg for a little single
fullish delivery, driven off a thick inside edge wide of mid-on for a quick single
full delivery at the off stump, pressed with a slightly open face to extra cover
straighter line and clipped past midwicket for a couple
shot! Too full and driven with perfect timing, opening the face to steer it wide of extra-cover
drags the length ball and a touch wider, Dilly can only flick this to backward point
another drive ball and well-timed again but straight to extra-cover
full delivery at the off stump, clipped via cover for a sharp single
pulled and missed, cry for lbw but surely going over the stumps, Rod Tucker says, nah mate
angled off the back foot to orthodox cover who is right on the edge of the circle
slightly tighter line, knocked to extra-cover this time
too short and width offered so Sangakkara can cut it up and over the covers, poor ball
around the wicket, angled in and Sangakkara gets a thick inside edge playing half-forward down to long leg
full delivery sliding across Sangakkara who chases it with a drive and misses
too straight and full and flicked delightfully past midwicket, great timing
more off stump line, firm drive straight to short extra-cover
better line and just blocked up on the leg side
fuller ball, pleasantly driven only as far as mid-off
full delivery just outside off, pressed into the point region
tossed up around off stump, firm press to short extra
slightly tighter line and slog swept over midwicket, bit of a hack but got enough bat on it to carry way over the infield and wide of deep-backward square
flatter ball, nudged back up the wicket
quicker but shovelled down leg
back across the stumps playing with the turn to square leg
slightly straighter and tickled past leg slip, chase back for backward square with the man in the deep now at midwicket, Bopara does well to save the boundary
too straight and it turns down leg again
just outside off, pressed back up to the bowler
length just outside off, driven gently into the covers
tighter line and blocked back to the bowler
full delivery at the stumps, flicked to short midwicket
slightly wider line, angled into the covers, the throw hit the striker's end stumps and deflects away for an overthrow
touch short and pulled hard and in the air...just short of deep square, almost hit that too well did Dilshan
full delivery on a tight line, blocked only to extra cover
length ball a couple of feet wide of off stump, a swing and a miss, too wide apparently
tighter line, a touch full, dabbed through the covers and they get back for the second
tighter line and just knocked up the wicket
too short and thrashed through the covers, brings the fifty partnership up

length a foot wide of off stump, tries to whack it through the off side again and drags on! Big wicket for England and the change works. A little lazy from Dilshan just trying to throw his hands at this and he's paid the price with a thick inside edge into off stumps
back of a length on the stumps, worked down to long leg
around the wicket angled in, Sangakkara forward pressing up towards mid-on
full ball a touch wide of off stump, gracefully angled down to third ma
around the wicket, a touch straight, worked wide of long leg and they get back for a second
full ball just outside off, Sangakkara presses forward and plays up to mid-on
drags the length back slightly, a more gentle front-foot stroke gets a thick inside edge via square leg

full just outside off, driven and edged to slip! Another big wicket and Woakes strikes on his return. A loose drive from Jayawardene and a thick outside edge flies to around a second slip where Jrodan takes a very solid catch at shoulder height, got to him pretty quickly
length ball that wobbles away from the right-hander, Mathews beaten fencing at it
length ball a touch wide of off stump, angled down to third man, wide enough for a couple
full length but well wide of off stump and left alone
tight off stump line now, press forward into the cover
angled in, this is dabbed behind midwicket and they get a quick single
too straight and clipped down the leg side, gets it fine of long leg, poor ball
off stump line on a length, defended up to mid-off
full at the off stump, blocked up into the covers
dabbed into midwicket, Morgan scrambles across the save the single...but then his throw deflects off the striker's end stumps and runs away from an overthrow. The second one of the innings
off stump line dropped into the covers
fourth-stump line again, blocked carefully from the crease into the off side
full ball angled towards off stump, blocked into point this time, Morgan again throws at the stumps, this time at the non-striker's end with Sangakkara planted two feet behind the popping crease!
straight line, knocked into the leg side and they get a single wide of mid-on
off stump line, tickled up towards mid-on and Finn almost runs straight past it but the fumble isn't bad enough to concede a second
a little straight and flicked down to long leg
full length just outside off, pressed into the covers
very full at the off stump, flicked to midwicket
straighter line, worked wide of midwicket for an easy single
a little wide of off stump, angled firmly from the crease to backward point
tossed up around off stump, Mathews playing forward defends
some turn here, it beats the inside edge and strikes the pad, probably going down
a lean forward outside off and gets a thick inside edge to square leg
tries to paddle sweep from outside off and misses, ball deflects off the pad towards point
a step down the wicket and plays up to short midwicket
looking to work leg side again and again struck on the pad
around the wicket, length on off stump, blocked firmly into extra cover
fuller length just outside off, pressed to backward point
wide line, a rather loose drive gets a thick outside edge but safely behind backward point to third man
length outside off, forced from the back foot wide of cover
length a foot outside off, pressed back to the bowler
full and wide, Mathews chases it again and gets another thick outside edge down to long leg
a foot outside off, played with the turn to square leg
paddle swept fine, deep-backward square is on the scene very quickly and managed to keep them to just the single
off stump line, played back up the wicket
down the track just padding up outside off stump
beauty, pitches on the stumps and turns right across Sangakkara who is squared up and beaten on the outside edge, that ball disturbed the surface
fuller ball, carefully dropped wide of midwicket
around the wicket, leg stump line, tickled out to deep square
full ball just outside off, flicked down to long-on
floated up, pressed firmly down to long-off
turn and the angle sends this just down leg from outside off, well taken from Buttler
fuller ball, whipped out down to long-on
off stump line, pressed off the back foot to cover
chucked up around off stump, defended carefully up the wicket
dabs this into the covers and calls for a quick single, Sangakkara through quickly
a touch wide and just a touch short, Sangakkara rocks right back and cuts past backward point
now too full from Tredwell, Sangakkara anticipated it, ran down to meet it on the full and flicks wide of deep midwicket, excellent batting
down again, not to the pitch, gets a thick leading edge into the covers and they refuse the single
back defending just outside off stump
floated up just outside off, blocked with the turn into midwicket
more air, a big stride in and driven down to long-on
punched off the back foot out to deep cover
waits in the crease for this to turn and drops it into midwicket
delicate paddle sweep and gets it very fine, it skips away to the rope, more pace to work with from Moeen
back and working this with the turn only to midwicket

forward beaten on the inside edge, cry for lbw, the umpire takes a very long time to decide but calls not out, England refuse the review and rightly so because the replay shows a big inside edge, everyone missed that
similar ball, more carefully defended with bat and pad tightly together
quicker ball, it skids on a little and Sangakkara is nearly beaten defending on the back foot
down the wicket and kicked away past cover, they take a leg bye but I'm not sure the the batsman played a stroke a that really
down the wicket and flicked down to long-on
right back and cut hard to point
flicked from off stump to square leg
slightly more outside off so this is flicked to midwicket
gets this square of midwicket and they're able to take the run
tossed up on the stumps, clipped out through midwicket, they charge for two but the deep fielder is in two quickly, 100 up
straight line, worked to square leg off the front foot
played forward and knocked to midwicket
played from off stump into the covers
down the wicket and clipped into the leg side, got right to the pitch and able to steer that wide of midwicket
premeditated paddle sweep out to deep-backward square
back playing from middle and off to cover
this skids on and almost gets through but Sangakkara gets a thick inside edge past square leg
down the wicket, meet this on the full and plays out to long-on
well forward playing from outside off to square leg
a shimmy down flicking from outside off through midwicket
a tad short and cut out to deep cover
flicked off the stumps to square leg
paddle swept from outside off, backward-square scrambles well to his right and saves the second
very full, dug out back to the bowler
around the wicket, this turns a long way down the leg side, and bounces, and is called wide, unlucky for Tredwell
straight line, carefully blocked back to the bowler
floated up, Sangakkara down to meet it pressing to mid-on and they get a sharp single
some more turn, strikes Mathews on the pad as he looked to play up the wicket
outside off, this is angled from the crease to backward point
back and working this to short midwicket
more air, flicked leg side and this time past the diving midwicket's left hand
slips down leg with some turn and the angle, Buttler takes it well
full delivery worked down to long-on
lovely bowling, tossed up and it turns and beats the outside edge of Sangakkara playing forward
touch wider line and he leaves this
shot! A little air and this is delightfully driven up and over extra-cover, perfect timing
back and touched to cover
forward now blocking to cover
around the wicket, a little short and wide and cut past backward point
immediately over the wicket, full delivery worked to midwicket
slower and some turn beats the inside edge and runs into the leg side
a little leading edge looking to play with the spin, safely short of the bowler
fuller and works this successfully out through the leg side
back and this skids on and nearly through Sangakkara again
back looking to flick to leg, struck on the thigh guard
paddle swept from outside off out to deep-backward square
waits for this in the crease and dabs carefully behind point for a quick single, good running
a big stride in, playing up to midwicket
more air, works this to midwicket from just outside off
back nudging across the line to square leg
forward and just blocked on off stump
fuller and worked out past short extra-cover for a single
floated up and it turns down leg for a wide! Harsh from the umpire again. But another great take from Buttler
forward flicking off the stumps to square leg
right across the stumps sweeping out to deep square, didn't want to miss that
full on the stumps, pressing down to long-on
off stump line, blocked in the crease
forward and pressed up the wicket from a straight line
touch short, it skids on a little and Sangakkara is back cutting hard to backward point
two feet wide of off stump, left alone
back pressing into the covers
fuller length, punched firmly down the ground and Sangakkara goes to another half-century! Superb form in this series
paddle swept from outside off, it runs out towards deep-backward square
off stump line, played from the crease into midwicket
turns down the leg side, Mathews gets a tickle on it into the deep
waited for in the crease and knocked into the gap at cover
full delivery, flicked out down to long-on
more air and driven but only to extra-cover
straighter line, swept out to deep square leg
full length just outside off, dropped into the covers
good length on off stump, defended carefully up the wicket
just back of a length, defended in the crease back to the bowler
full length, driven firmly back to the bowler and a very stiff caught and bowled chance is shelled, Jordan just stuck out a left hand and it didn't stick
touch wider line and guided superbly wide of third man, gorgeous timing, steered perfectly away
drops the length and a tighter line, defended to the bowler once more
around the wicket, swept off the leg stump, misses, stuck on the pad
length ball, tucked out through square leg for an easy single
full just down leg, swept at and missed, comes of Buttler's pad for a wide
tossed up, driven on the full back to the bowler
tossed up wide of off stump, left alone
straighter line and swept out to backward-square
defended in the crease off into the leg side
around the wicket, angled to a tight off stump line, Sangakkara blocks it into the off side
fuller ball, dabbed into the covers, Sangakkara looking for a single that's never there
length ball running towards off stump, Sangakkara lets it come on and dabs down to third man
just back of a length outside off, dabbed into the point region
nicely bowled, fuller length a beats the outside edge with Mathews poking at it a foot outside off

back of a length on the stumps, Mathews goes for a short-arm paddle pull and gets a thick top edge that carries to long leg! There's the breakthrough England so needed. Funny stroke, Mathews just looking to help this on it's way around the corner but maybe got surprised by the pace. A big top edge flew down to Woakes who bagged a simple catch
full delivery pressed down to long-on
firm press just outside off wide of mid-off and Thirimanne is away immediately
full delivery ran from off stump back to the bowler
more air and touch wider, angled out through the covers
big stride in to block firmly up the wicket
opens the face and steers this defensive stroke back to the bowler
perfect start for Sri Lanka, short and wide enough to cut for four
full delivery, driven smartly down the ground, half-saved from the bowler, cleaned up by mid-on
length angled at off stump, Sangakkara defending into the leg side, Jordan follows through and saves the single
similar delivery, clipped to midwicket this time
fullish length a touch wider, driven to cover
fine straight drive, excellently saved by Jordan with his left hand and had Jordan shied at the stumps he might have had Sangakkara scrambling because he was diving back into his ground
waited for and driven from just outside off to point
tossed up, defended firmly off a thick inside edge to midwicket
back on the stumps, flicked out to midwicket
forward press from off stump into the covers
forward and a cry for lbw but there was a big inside edge on this, bang in front mind
another big lean forward and blocks this into the covers
slower ball outside off, swung at and missed, it bounces twice before Buttler and runs off his pads for a bye
full and wide delivery, driven without timing to extra-cover
tighter line, waited for and angled down to third man, not wide enough of him for a second
length at the off stump, driven firmly to cover
down the track and lifts this over mid-off, top shot, in total control, give himself room to play and times it perfectly for a one-bounce four

swings leg side this time, in the air towards deep cover and just short of the onrushing James Taylor who might not have picked it up straight away, great effort still, diving forward and saving a couple
back and this stops in the pitch and Thirimanne loops it up into the covers but short of short extra-cover
forward and a firm drive to long-off
back and punched firmly out to deep cover
full delivery, driven firmly to Tredwell's right hand
waited for and square-driven at the last moment past backward point, lovely stroke
more air and straight, defended firmly into extra-cover
down the track and slapped out wide of deep cover but not far enough for a second
full delivery, a firm punch down to long-off
a little straight a lifted up leg side wide of deep midwicket, lovely timing, a graceful slog sweep
forward pokes this to point from just outside off
clears the front leg and swings this down to long-off
waited for in the crease and turned out to point
floated up on the stumps, swept out to deep square

swept from the off stump, misses, there's a cry for lbw and given out! The umpire had a long think but raised the finger. Thirimanne goes for the review. Did he get outside the line? Possibility of an underedge too maybe. Nope that's plumb in line with middle and off and Hawk Eye has it going on to hit middle an inch from the top, so an excellent decision from the umpire and Tredwell strikes

tossed right up, Mendis pokes at it and gets beaten by a lovely spinning delivery, Buttler whips off the bails and Rod Tucker will check but I'm sure Mendis is well back. Actually he does lift his foot momentarily but got back in time
swept from outside off into the deep on the leg side
two feet wide of off stump, this is left alone
flatter ball, worked out to deep square from off the stumps
pressed from just outside off to cover
worked slightly across the line wide enough of the bowler's left hand for a sharp single, good batting getting Sangakkara back on strike
step down the wicket and hit over mid-on, a gentle lift well-timed
full on the stumps, pressed carefully down the ground to mid-off
full delivery dropped out into a vacant midwicket area, they can charge back for the second
delicately dropped to play with the turn in front of point for a sharp single
swept from a long way outside off, gets it fine of the deep square and they take two
goes for the reverse sweep but it was thrown right up and Mendis couldn't adjust and misses
the latest of late cuts, it was a thin outside edge and deflects of Buttler's gloves, not really a chance at all
floated up on the off stump, blocked back to the bowler
wider on the crease, it grips a little and Mendis is just blocking in front of off stump
very full, swept, just squeezes it away to short long leg
length ball whacked leg side but straight to the deep midwicket but James Taylor misfields and so the second run is very comfortable
length just outside off, waited for and angled to backward point, another pointless throw at the stumps almost concedes overthrows
slower ball on the stumps, pulled out to deep square
length angled in, defended in the crease, it runs out into the leg side and they steal a single
yorker length just outside off, dug out to backward point
step away to leg, Jordan follows him and Sangakkara swivels on a short ball and gets it out to deep square
wild leg side delivery, 10 more wides today from England so far
gives himself some room and slaps hard over extra-cover, great shot

back of a length, clears the front leg and swings leg side and picks out deep midwicket. Another clean strike but didn't get the elevation/couldn't keep it down, and flew it straight to Root who came in a few yards to take a straightforward chance. Sangakkara falls just short of a century again

back of a length, angled down to third man, Perera is coming back for a second but is sent back, the throw comes in and Buttler has dropped the ball with an easy run-out at his mercy, poor work from the keeper, Perera was stranded
back of a length at the off stump, defended into the off side slightly hurriedly

back of a length just outside off, a delicate flick down to third man, Bopara fields, in comes the throw and oh my goodness is deflects off the stumps and goes for an overthrow! This is getting ridiculous, Buttler couldn't gather the throw again but it was very difficult that time

bumper, Mendis struck on the helmet trying to hook and it loops back to Woakes who appeals for the catch, not out given but Woakes goes for the review straight away and the replay shows a clear top edge so this will be overturned and Mendis is out caught and bowled. The short ball works for Woakes
short and a touch wide, cut at and missed
bumper goes over leg stump, well ducked
another bumper, this over the off stump, ducked once more
fuller, nudged back to the bowler, Jordan fields with his left hand then turns and had he thrown down the non-striker's stump, Senanayake was stranded
short again, this time played at because it was wider of off stump and Perera uppercuts to good effect wide of third man
fuller on the leg stump, clipped away in the air but landed just short of deep midwicket, it was very well timed
length ball only just outside off and Perera backs away and cracks it in front of point, what a shot! Can't complain with the delivery really
goes shorter and straighter, this pull is mistimed to short midwicket
short again, another mistimed pull and it loops over midwicket and short of the deep fielder, as lucky as you can get
full at the off stump, blocked in the crease and ran to midwicket

goes down the track and looks to swing down the ground but misses and is bowled! England continue to pick up wickets. A wild swipe this really, got in a poor position. And not sure why he's trying to swing that anyway after just a couple of deliveries. Down goes the leg stump
bumper just outside off is too short
now this slips down leg and England have now given away another two free overs in this match
off stump on a length, angled down to third man
forward and angled out down to third man again
gives himself room to the leg side and swings hard through the line, a right old slog but it clears Finn and skips away to the rope
short ball pulled leg side and gets enough of it to send it over midwicket, another big heave, very useful this
steps to leg again, Jordan follows him and it's squeezed out to midwicket
back of a length at the body, a tuck into midwicket and gets Perera back on strike
and now one down leg, Jordan just losing his way a little here after a good spell
firm punch straight to backward point and they take the run straight to the fielder
short ball too short, Perera backed away but left this and it sailed harmlessly by
total adjustment, yorker length well wide of off stump, it skids wickedly onto Buttler who can't gather it and they scramble a bye
another short ball, flicked at, it goes very very fine and Buttler takes off to his right to almost take a catch but more importantly save four
length ball smashed down the ground, backing away once more and it races away from mid-on
goes short once more, Perera pulls out of the hook and Woakes is wided again. This seemed a much tighter call but we don't get the side-on replay

full at the stumps and smashed leg side, it sounded clunky, and it finds deep midwicket. Another easy catch for Joe Root coming a few yards off the boundary. Perera not finding the connection on this occasion and his very useful cameo comes to an end
cutter on the stumps, angled down to third man

full and straight and cleans him up! The batsman totally missing the ball and losing his middle and off stumps, completing a fine spell from Woakes, the first five-for by an England bowler in Sri Lanka, finished the innings off very nicely

inn2.comm: a little short and Cook goes back and cuts out through cover, lovely start for the England captain
back again, this time only pushing to short extra cover
back again, this skids on a little towards off stump but Cook late cuts and gets it away backward of short third man, it skips away to the rope again
fuller ball, this is just defended into the covers
back and cutting again, mistimed to cover
this skids onto towards off stump again and Cook forward to knock out into the covers
aaaaahhhhoooooo...no ball!! Only kidding, full and defended into the off side
too full outside off and Moeen drives with a flourish through cover
tighter line and defended up the wicket

goes for a slog sweep, misses and is bowled! And it's ugly too. A hack to leg really, a complete miss and the off stump is clipped back. That didn't look good. Maybe he was anticipating turn away from the stumps? It went straight on, past the heave to leg and took out off stump. Not very good that all considered from Moeen
forward pressing up to mid-on and calls for a sharp single, home easily
forward, this slides on again, beats the inside edge and a huge cry for lbw, not out given and they decline the review, probably sliding down
down the track, not to the pitch, having to lean for it and gets it to midwicket
from the crease playing with the angle to midwicket
forward pressing into the leg side and another sharp single is called for
back waiting for this to slide on and he punches to short extra
floated up, Cook well forward to press down to long-off
Taylor flicking leg side again but this time no single available
forward defending off inside edge and pad just outside off
firm press forward and ran down to long-off, why is this fielder back for?
a skip down the wicket, turns this wide of mid-on and takes off for a quick single, busy start for Taylor
forward to a straight ball, defended back to the bowler
forward again, thick inside edge through square leg, again, why is any fielder back for Cook?
stays around the wicket and cramps Taylor up a little, he defends back on the stumps
forward to a length ball knocking this towards point
fuller, Cook forward playing back to the bowler
straighter line and flicked through midwicket, again, the fielders back on the leg side, easy single, perhaps having midwicket back encourages Cook to play across the line so fair enough
forward with very firm hands, chips it back to the bowler almost
forward just blocking
down the track and a lovely pick up over long-on, right to the pitch of the ball and a nicely timed drive over the top
around the wicket, forward block from Cook
a little short and an easy flick through midwicket
forward on off stump pressing into the covers
right back to a slightly short delivery and pulled to deep square
forward just outside off to calmly dead-pan this ball
full on the leg stump, Cook gets a little tickle off the pad past short leg and Taylor calls for the single in a flash
touch wide of off stump, Cook forward blocking out to point
a little short, cut hard but only to cover on the edge of the circle
a little leading edge aiming a touch leg side to a straight ball, runs safely out to backward point
strong lean forward to press into the covers
very full on leg side, swept and squeezed away past short long leg, this will run away for four
back on off stump, pressed up the wicket
around the wicket, Taylor forward to a middle and off stump line, plays out to point
leg stump now and swept calmly to deep square
forward pressing to the left hand of the bowler who scrambles across to field
back and getting struck on the pad as this skids on a little
back with time to play, flicks wide of mid-on, not quite the timing to get it to the rope but it runs out for two, could have been three perhaps

forward, beaten on the inside edge again, another lbw cry and this time given out! Cook has a chat with Taylor but declines to review and trudges off. Cook misreads the delivery again, absolutely no spin, it slid on past the inside edge, striking the pad below the knee roll and the umpire, after a long think, was sure it was going on to hit leg stump probably. Hawk Eye has it clipping a fair chunk of leg stump
full length, defended on the front foot back to the bowler
back of a length, back and knocked into the covers
oh hello, a shimmy down and then across the stumps to try and pull a ball not all that short and misses
length a foot wide of off stump, angled down to third man
length at the off stump, Root defending from the crease up the wicket
back again to a decent length delivery, knocks this into the covers
forward defending around off stump
around the wicket now, blocking from the crease in front of middle and leg
a shimmy down the crease and flick through midwicket, they run hard and get back for the second
back playing a ball that slides on back to the bowler
fuller ball, knocks this back to the bowler once more
down the wicket again and well-timed flick past mid-on, deep midwicket is around to keep it to a single
back of a length, dabbed from off stump to backward point, no run possible there
touch wider and fuller and this is easy to guide down to third man
full on the stumps, flicked towards mid-on and Root takes off for a quick single, a direct hit would have had him
a cutter, Taylor forward, waits, waits, waits and then late cuts to third man
back playing from the crease to mid-on
fuller ball that slides towards off stump, Root knocks it towards point
full and wide...and a wide
tighter line to off stump, left alone
short and wide this time...are you England in disguise?
fuller and tighter to off stump, left alone
good line again, decent length n'all, Taylor forward and shouldering arms again
short and wide, a firm cut and powerfully struck wide of deep cover
very full at the pads, good job there was an edge involved as Taylor looked to flick leg side otherwise that was plumb in front
wide again and slashed at, it wasn't quite short enough for a full-blown cut, Taylor misses
slower ball, flicked from off stump to mid-on
shorter length and worked leg side, only as far as midwicket
cutter on off stump, patted from out towards point
another cutter, turned out to deep square and the fifty comes up with a wave of a union flag from the stands
fuller ball, worked to midwicket hanging back in the crease
another offcutter, taken from just outside off straight to mid-on

back of a length, leaves Taylor a little, playing away from his body gets a thick outside edge that flies just out of the reach of a diving Jayawardene at wide slip, maybe a third slip position, and down fine of third man
very full now, squeezed out to long leg
full length just outside off, driven and well-saved at extra-cover
full again a touch wider of off stump, I reckon this leaves Root a little and he plays and misses with a forward prod
yorker on the stumps, dug out up to mid-on
length ball on off stump, worked back to the bowler from the crease
forward press just outside off, drops this into the covers
forward again to a straighter ball, plays this back to the bowler
stays back to press from off stump to short extra
down the wicket and flicked up to mid-on
a little short, cut well but Dilshan dives and saves at short extra, great work Dilly
down the track and opens the face playing with the gentle turn down to long-off
drifts into the pads and comes off the thigh pad and runs fine of long leg
low full toss that is driven back to the bowler, Prasad gets a left boot on it and kicks it to extra cover to save the single
full length just outside off, driven and squeezes this past cover
forward opening the face to third man and whoops, very poor fielding by Thisara Perera on the boundary and it slips through his hands
angled to third man again...ooooooohhhhhhhh...safely does the business this time
length on off stump and knocked to extra cover
touch short and pulled out along the ground to deep midwicket
back and punching down to long-off
full length on off stump, pressed to extra cover
some air just outside off and Root slog sweeps well to wide long-on, a meaty strike and I think it's carried all the way into the rope has it? Nope, just short
forward to a ball a foot wide of off stump, angled out to deep cover
back and cut hard to deep cover from just outside off
too short and pulled but straight to deep midwicket
full ball on the off stump, a pleasant drive steered wide of deep cover and they can get back for two
wide of off stump and this is dabbed backward of point and it skips away almost for four, fielder back just in time from short third man
too short and easily forced out to deep cover
seemed to come out of the side of the hand, full and flicked wide of long-on, excellent running brings a second
full at the pads, clipped to square leg
slides into the batsman, a little short, so easily pulled out to deep square
back and tucked from middle and leg to midwicket
back and flicked to square leg this time
trying to late cut from outside off, the delivery was too full for the stroke and Root plays and misses
forward with a firm flick to midwicket, in the air for a moment
back and clips to the fielder again, this time square leg, Root just getting a little stuck there
too short and pulled, can't get it in the gap so just a single
tossed up, pressed from just outside off to extra cover
off stump line, Root back and clipping out to deep cover
down the wicket and right to the pitch, driving down to long-off
ooo nice, turn and grip away from the outside edge, the first one that's really gone today
floated up and driven from off stump to short extra-cover
back pressing into midwicket from the stumps
some turn down the leg side, takes the pad and runs fine of deep-backward square for two
off stump line and quite full, defended back up the wicket
paddle swept off the stumps, excellent stroke, lifted it up the attempted catch of Sangakkara who scrambled across to his left, using the pace nicely Taylor gets four
down the wicket, clipping down to long-on for an easy run
back and clipping past midwicket for a single into the deep, better from Root
back exposing the stumps but well in control pushing out to deep cover
down the wicket and driven, oh my goodness, straight through Dilshan at short extra! A real rarity, just a single down the ground though
full length just outside off, driven out to deep cover
a skip down, almost yorks himself and digs this back to the bowler
forward and a scampered single to mid-on, a terrible throw has to be tidied up by backward point
reverse paddle, using the pace, not quite got it completely, enough to bring the hundred up
premeditated paddle sweep, Sangakkara tries the premeditated catch but Taylor gets it wide of the fielder
back and pressing wide of midwicket into the deep
from the crease turning a straight ball to square leg
a little short and belted down the ground, pulled right back past the bowler and it's four inside long-on
down the track and now steadily clipped straight to long-on
back across the stumps, nudged to midwicket
but this has turned, Taylor follows it and get a thin outside edge fine of short third man, it runs away for two
down the wicket, an edge into the leg side and they steal a single, superb running
leg stump delivery, clipped out wide of deep square and they come back for a comfortable second
swept straight to short long leg and again they steal a run they have no right to take, that was straight to the fielder who was on his heels
floated up, driven firmly back down the ground and this is well saved from the bowler
back pushing from the off stump just wide of cover and there another very sharp single
full at the off stump, pressed carefully into extra cover
slightly shorter and straighter, tucked wide of midwicket for an easy single
full at the stumps, tucked up to midwicket
a foot wide of off stump, angled out to third man
full length at the off stump, press back to the bowler
back of a length, whipped out to long leg
glorious batting, a quick shimmy down the wicket, right to the pitch of the ball and flicks it wide of mid-on, great timing
a little short from a foot wide of off stump, goodness it rags away and Taylor does well to leave it alone
fuller ball and blocked up the wicket
too full and flicked to mid-on, can't find the gap here, they get a sharp single
back and clipping a straight delivery to deep midwicket
back and pushing firmly from off stump to deep cover
full length at the stumps, Taylor forward playing up to mid-on
forward on off stump, knocking this to cover
full length just outside off, slapped rather off the toe to extra cover
wider line and drives this out to deep cover
full delivery a foot outside off, driven steadily to deep cover
length delivery, Taylor lets it come onto him and angles it out to third man
full ball just outside off, driven to the right of mid-off for an easy single
full length just outside off, blocked only back to the bowler
swept from a foot outside off and missed completely, again absolutely no turn, although that did disturb the surface
touch short and pulled hard and picks the gap wide of deep square, nice shot, not the best delivery
this time played straight to deep deep with a flick off the back foot
press to mid-off and a scampered single brings up the hundred stand
full on the off stump, well driven to mid-off, no single available there
flashing square drive, just letting a length ball come on outside off, gets it wide of deep cover and Taylor scurries back for the second
driven just to the right of mid-off, fielder under pressure again and again there's a mistake that makes the single easy
touch too wide of the off stump and driven out to deep cover

back of a length and pulled away, bit of a top edge and finds long leg! Poor dismissal and Taylor falls when going so well and Sri Lanka have a badly-needed breakthrough. Taylor couldn't keep the pull down and flew it straight to the fielder who claimed an easy chance. Quite an innocuous dismissal...
straight ball knocked into midwicket, they take on the fielder and again the pressure forces the mistake, a wild throw and there's overthrows out to third man in the end
clipped from off stump to midwicket who goes to his right and saves well
fuller ball and clipped firmly out to deep midwicket
forward press and this slips past the outside edge
forward press and gets this in front of backward point for an easy single
back and turns this to square leg
forward playing to the right of cover for a sneaky single
full length just outside off, angled out down to third man
forward dabbed just behind backward point for an easy single
back and pressing firmly to backward point
forward just outside off, pressing to extra cover
waited for in the crease and dabbed from just outside off towards third man, easy single
tries another late cut but too close to backward point for the run
back and tucked past square leg with some spin! Fielder was deceived
back trying to cut and the ball slips under the bat
a no-ball! Goodness me, dropped into the covers for an easy single, Mendis was a mile over the popping crease
free hit...down the track but flicking only all along the floor wide of long-on so they get back for the second, 150 up
back forcing from off stump out to deep cover
forward and rolled up to mid-off, no run attempted
outside off, chance to cut but Bopara picks out short third man
back of a length, waited for in the crease and angled out to third man
fuller length but still a foot wide of off stump, Bopara dabs it down to third man
slightly tighter line and this time Root can only find point
drifts the line to leg but Root gets a little too much bat on it to long leg
full at the off stump, just blocked back to the bowler
tight line again and blocked back to the bowler
a touch short and cut to cover
fuller and swept well, timed excellently past long-on, taken from outside off that
goes again, this from a full toss again outside off, same gap wide of long-on
tossed right up, left alone pitching on a fourth-stump line
back and clipping a googly out to deep midwicket
forward carefully pushing into extra-cover
back of a length wide of off stump, cut off a thin outside edge, it flies down and away from Sangakkara's outstretched right hand
cut properly this time out to deep cover
full a foot or so outside off, driven very nicely, opening the face to steer it past extra-cover and wide of the sweeper for an easy second
straight ball just blocked back to the bowler
forward to block, a little late on the stroke but gets it out off the inner half of the bat towards square leg for a quick single
rocks back to try and cut a ball probably too full for the stroke and misses
waits for this and turns out to deep square
forward flicked off the stumps to square leg
swept in controlled fashion out to deep midwicket
wide of off stump, Bopara trying to fiddle it on the off side plays all round it really
fuller and straighter and knocked up on the leg side
fuller ball dropped up towards midwicket, no single available despite Root's endeavours
straight delivery knocked straight back to the bowler
reverse swept well and well saved at short third man by Thirimanne, good save
off stump line, knocked back up the wicket
touch short, Bopara back in a flash to pull down to long-on
down the track and flicked wide of long-on, nice placement and a couple more
touch short now and wheeled around to deep square
back and flicking out to deep midwicket
down the wicket, bowler drops his length, Bopara adjusts and tries to flick leg side, Jayawardene gathers at leg slip and had it thrown the stumps down Bopara may have been short
goes to angle outside off and misses
presses leg side this time and they take a sharp single
well forward and a comfy press out to long-on
back nudging this wide of point and they take an easy run
a touch too full just outside off and Bopara punches past extra cover, great timing and steered it well in the gap
fuller still on the leg stump, hits the pad to square leg, lucky to get away with that line - bat involved apparently
good length driven straight to extra cover
length ball a foot wide of off stump, calmly dropped down to third man
another firm punch but this time straight at extra-cover
straighter line, nudged up to mid-on and they take on the fielder and it's a poor throw - Sri Lanka's fielding has been found wanting under pressure today
full on off stump, dropped back to the bowler
back now and forcing this wide of extra-cover for a single
reverse=swept, didn't really time it but got it fine of short third man for an easy single
back clipping to midwicket
back again just covering up in front of middle and off
tossed up a bit more, dropped into the covers but no run available
good length on off stump just blocked
back of a length, Root picks it very early and whacks it wide of deep midwicket, great timing
touch fuller but Root still able to hang back and clips this out to deep square
full length just outside off, forward dropping this to cover
back across the stumps, knocks this down in front of midwicket and they take a sharp single
down the wicket and works a back of a length ball wide out through midwicket, to the right of the deep man and they charge back for the second, 200 comes up
full length, dropped back to the bowler
touch more air and Bopara rocks forward and clips with the angle out through square leg
goes to flick to leg and gets struck on the pad which runs back to the bowler
touch fuller and this is dropped down to long-on
touch straighter now and worked through midwicket
back flicking from middle and off out through midwicket
hangs back and angled to short third man
down the wicket and nudging back to the bowler
trying to work through the leg side but only finds midwicket
too wide of off stump and cracked out to deep cover
too wide again and easy to waltz out to the off side sweeper
and again, very very easy for England
around the wicket, tossed up onto the stumps, flicked only to square leg
swept now, gets it fine of deep square and they get back for the second
forward pressing only as far as midwicket
a step down and knocking this to extra cover
back and forces this nicely away wide of deep cover for another easy couple
wider line and cut, bit off the toe, runs fine of short third man for two more
full ball, driven back up past the bowler and they take a single to the right of mid-off
leg stump line and dropped out to deep midwicket
touch short and cut out to deep cover
a firm step down and works a straight ball to midwicket
more air, nudged carefully to extra cover
back in the crease forcing away through point, the sweeper is across quickly to save the second
swept off the stumps out to deep square
back playing to midwicket
back again, finds long-on this time
around the wicket, it started leg stump and turned down the leg side, no wide given
nudged off the stumps to square leg, a smart save down low
off stump line, flicked firmly past midwicket
down the track, bowler drops his length, Root adjusts and plays down to long-on
chipped down the ground, well short of long-on
goes to slog sweep a ball from outside off and misses, it goes past everything by a small margin
more air, Root tries to swing it down the ground is beaten by some turn
fuller length, clipped to midwicket
swept off the stumps in the air to the deep square fielder but well short
swept in the air again and it drops just short of deep square again, another top edge
down the wicket and just calmly blocked to midwicket
down the track and pushed only back to the bowler

a shuffle down and tries to swing this out of the ground but doesn't quite get all of it and it's taken by long-on! An excellent catch stumbling towards the rope but he held on well a foot inside the boundary. It was firm strike from Bopara but he couldn't get the elevation right and it was a good catch
reverse swept off the stumps first ball and gets it over backward point, what a shot first up, timing perfectly
just defended this from leg stump up on the leg side
slog swept from outside off and it clears midwicket! What a shot! Perfect timing, nails it over the rope for a superb century
short outside off, cut to extra cover who fumbles and they get a single
carefully nudged from leg stump out to deep-backward square
single nudged out to long-on
forward press to cover
tries to win it and caught on the rope! Morgan can't quite finish the job, going for a bit shot over long-on, didn't get all of it and it was solidly held
delicate paddle sweep behind square, it runs away for a couple and England are home!
